sourceMeaningMnemonic: The <radical>scooter</radical> is <radical>white</radical>. This color will <kanji>urge</kanji> and <kanji>compel</kanji> you to use it. Scooter companies use colors to get you to do what they want. Some would say they are trying to <kanji>coerce</kanji> you, even.
meaningInfo: Look at how white the scooter is. It urges you to use it. It compels you. You feel coerced...
readingMnemonic: When they <kanji>urge</kanji>, <kanji>compel</kanji> and <kanji>coerce</kanji> you like this, they are <reading>hack</reading>ing (<ja>はく</ja>) your brain.
readingInfo:
Really all marketing, advertising, and the like is just a hack of your brain.

Hint: If you see <ja>白</ja> in a kanji, there's a good likelihood the reading will be <ja>はく</ja>.
